text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]f(x) = x[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]g(x) = 1[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]h(x) = 1-x[/mathjaxinline]. Using the inner product on the vector space [mathjaxinline]C[0,2][/mathjaxinline] as described earlier, which pairs of functions are orthogonal? Check all that are.

font.p: We can calculate [mathjaxinline]\langle f, g\rangle = 2[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]\langle f, h\rangle = -2/3[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]\langle g,h \rangle = 0[/mathjaxinline]. Hence the only pair which is orthogonal is [mathjaxinline]g[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]h[/mathjaxinline].
